result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth Hopgood Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kenneth Hopgood Jr in court.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Kenneth Hopgood Jr.  Attorney Michelle A. Grasso in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a jury trial.  Court is in a jury trial with another case.  Case is unable to be spun.  Case is adjourned to 1-17-2023 at 8:30 am for jury trial.
Jury trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. State's Amended Witness List

Defendant Kenneth Hopgood in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Jury Trial.  State advises Court they are still waiting on additional medical records and requests adjourned trial date.  Defense does not object.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Jury trial scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Notice of Motion to Adjourn, filed.

Defendant Kenneth Hopgood in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Jury trial scheduled for 6-13-22.  State does not have medical records and is requesting an adjournment of the jury trial. Defense does not object.  Jury trial set for 6-13-22 is vacated.  Case is adjourned to 8-8-22 at 8:30 am for jury trial.  Jury trial scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. State's Motion in Limine

Defendant Kenneth Hopgood in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kenneth Hopgood appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense counsel requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Kenneth Hopgood Jr
Current: 9220 North 75th Street, #321, Milwaukee, WI 53223   (Effective: 03-11-2022)
Prior: 4865 N 64th St, Milwaukee, WI 53218

Defendant Kenneth Hopgood in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. *Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

ADDRESS INFO for Kenneth Hopgood Jr
Current: 4865 N 64th St, Milwaukee, WI 53218   (Effective: 02-24-2022)
Prior: 9220 North 75th Street, #321, Milwaukee, WI 53223

Court ordered no contact with Lynnsey C.B.; Faith N.C.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Kenneth Hopgood in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Kenneth Hopgood in custody.  Allysa Bria Brown appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kenneth Hopgood appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 1.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
